curriculum_stages.name: Basic Hit or Stand
curriculum_stages.description: Agent learns the fundamental actions of hitting (drawing another card) and standing (ending the hand). The agent should learn when to hit to improve its hand and when to stand to avoid busting. Focus is on understanding the basic rules of Blackjack and the dealer's strategy.

curriculum_stages.name: Advanced Hit or Stand (Dealer Shows)
curriculum_stages.description: Agent builds on Stage 1 by incorporating the dealer's visible card into its decision-making.  Agent learns to adjust its hit/stand strategy based on the dealer's upcard. For example, hitting more often against a dealer showing a strong card.

curriculum_stages.name: Introducing Double Down
curriculum_stages.description: The 'Double Down' action is introduced. Agent learns when doubling down is advantageous, focusing on strong starting hands.  Agent needs to balance the increased risk (only one more card) with the potential reward (doubled payout).

curriculum_stages.name: Full Blackjack (Split)
curriculum_stages.description: The complete action set is available. Agent learns the optimal splitting strategy for pairs.  The agent now must integrate all available actions (Hit, Stand, Double Down, Split) to maximize its expected reward, adapting its strategy to different game states.
